intro: Seriphidium kasakorum, commonly known as the Karakorum wormwood, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Seriphidium kasakorum is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
